elements.title: Night of the Living Dead (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Night of the Living Dead (film featured) was mistakenly released into the public domain?

elements.title: Connecticut field pumpkin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a variety of the Connecticut field pumpkin is known as "the original commercial jack-o'-lantern pumpkin"?

elements.title: .monsters (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that there are nearly one hundred thousand .monsters on the internet?

elements.title: Faculty Club at UC Berkeley (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that The Faculty Club at UC Berkeley, built in 1902, has been reported to be a hotspot for paranormal activity?

elements.title: The Hunger (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that British designer Alexander McQueen pressed live worms into a translucent corset to evoke vampirism and undeath for his collection The Hunger?

elements.title: erotic horror (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that various online retailers removed hundreds of books featuring erotic horror from their stores?

elements.title: Halloween song (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that "Thriller" is the most popular Halloween song in the United States?

elements.title: The Exorcist (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that film critics accused the MPAA ratings board of having yielded to studio pressure to rate The Exorcist R rather than X?

elements.title: Miss Pumpkin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Circleville Pumpkin Show, the oldest pumpkin show in the United States, has been selecting a Miss Pumpkin since 1933?

elements.title: The Wiccan Web (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that The Wiccan Web recommends drawing pentagrams on your computer screen in oil?
